channel.title: Andrew Scheer
channel.description: Recent news about Andrew Scheer, from openparliament.ca.

item.title: Mentioned by Hill Times (subscription)
item.description:
Conservative MP Tweed's resignation now official in Brandon-Souris riding, four ...
Four byelections that could be crucial for Liberal Leader Justin Trudeau are now set for an undisclosed date likely in early November after Commons Speaker Andrew Scheer officially notified Chief Electoral Officer Marc Mayrand of the fourth House vacancy ...

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Sitting in at the Prince's Operation Entrepreneur Program at the U of R. It's a great program aimed at helping armed forces personnel..(1/2)

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: SK has so much to offer! Just spent 4 days in PA national park. Great weather and lots to do kept the kids off the ipads and away from TV.

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Dr. Andrea McCrady, Dominion Carillonneur is playing the Royal Anthem in the Peace Tower at 4pm in honour of the royal birth!

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Congratulations to Prince William and the Duchess of Cambridge! Glad to hear the baby and Duchess are doing well.

item.title: Mentioned by CTV News
item.description:
MP Glover files new expense claim amid election expense scandal
House Speaker Andrew Scheer says it's up to the committee on procedure and House affairs to decide if Glover and her Manitoba colleague James Bezan should lose their MP privileges until their fight with Elections Canada is settled. Scheer had earlier ...

item.title: Mentioned by Vancouver Sun
item.description:
Commons Speaker sends MP suspension question to committee
House Speaker Andrew Scheer announced the decision by the MP for St. Boniface on Tuesday as he handed a committee the tricky question of whether Glover and James Bezan, the Tory MP for Selkirk-Interlake, should be suspended over doubtful ...

item.title: Mentioned by Castanet.net
item.description:
Committee to decide fate of two MPs
Manitoba Conservative MP Shelly Glover has changed her mind and decided to file a new expense claim with Elections Canada for the 2011 federal election. House Speaker Andrew Scheer announced the decision by the MP for St. Boniface on Tuesday as ...

item.title: Mentioned by Windsor Star
item.description:
Conservative MPs face review over election spending
House of Commons Speaker Andrew Scheer ruled Tuesday in favour of a Liberal MP who argued that two elected Conservatives must undergo a parliamentary review because of a campaign spending dispute with Elections Canada. Liberal MP Scott ...
